direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental for object comparison and hash code generation, often used together in hash-based collections.
The hashCode method uses the key's hash code, making it structurally similar to methods that access the key.
The hashCode method uses the value's hash code, making it structurally similar to methods that access the value.
The hashCode method in AbstractHashedMap serves the same purpose but operates on a different data structure, making it substitutable for testing purposes.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing the map is a prerequisite for generating a hash code, as it sets up the key-value pairs.
Adding key-value pairs affects the state of the map, which in turn affects the hash code calculation.
Verifying the consistency of the hash code ensures that the hashCode method behaves as expected under different states of the map.
